Definition: A normalized measure of overall season-level impact. Calculated by summing the percentile ranks of PER, BPM, and WS: Impact Score = PR(adv_PER) + PR(adv_BPM) + PR(adv_WS).
Measures performance relative to a player's own peak efficiency. Scales PER between 0 and 1 using the player's career-high PER: Age Curve Index = adv_PER/max(adv_PER).
Statistics recorded during the final 5 minutes of a game when the score differential is 5 points or less.
A rating of a player's per-minute productivity.
A box score estimate of the points per 100 possessions a player contributed above a league-average player.
An estimate of the number of wins contributed by a player.
An estimate of the number of wins contributed by a player per 48 minutes (league avg is ~0.100).
A measure of shooting efficiency that takes into account field goals, 3-point field goals, and free throws.
An estimate of the percentage of team plays used by a player while they are on the floor.
An estimate of the percentage of teammate field goals a player assisted while on the floor.
An estimate of the percentage of available rebounds a player grabbed while on the floor.
